answerText: GABA or gamma-aminobutyric acid[10] The axons of these cells found in the middle cortical layer of the cerebellum release GABA. They are innervated by climbing fibers.

subject: Science
question: Question: This molecule's receptor helps regulate chloride concentrations. For 10 points each: [10] Name the chief inhibitory neurotransmitter in the body.
